description: Number of positive integers, k, where k <= n and GCD(k,n) = GCD(k+1,n) = 1.
comments: Called the Schemmel totient function in the Handbook of Number Theory II. - _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 15 2011
links: Enrique Pérez Herrero, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
Walter Klotz, Torsten Sander, Some Properties of Unitary Cayley Graphs, The Electronic Journal of Combinatorics, Volume 14 (2007), #R45. See Corollary 7 p. 4.
formula: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p^(e-1)*(p-2). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Dec 01 2001a(n) = Sum_{d|n} n/d*mu(d)*tau(d). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Apr 29 2002a(n) = Sum_{d divides n} phi(n/d)*(-1)^omega(d). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Sep 26 2002A003557(n) | a(n). - _R. J. Mathar_, Mar 30 2011a(n) = n*product_{primes p|n} (1-2/p). Dirichlet g.f. zeta(s-1)*product_p (1-2*p^(-s)). - _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 15 2011
example: a(15) = 3 because 1 and 2, 7 and 8 and 13 and 14 are all relatively prime to 15.a(15) = a(3*5) = a(3)*a(5) = 3^0*(3-2)*5^0*(5-2) = 3.
maple: A058026 := proc(n) local a; a := n ; for p in numtheory[factorset](n) do a := a*(1-2/p) ; end do: a ; end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 15 2011
mathematica: a[n_] := DivisorSum[n, n/# MoebiusMu[#] DivisorSigma[0, #]&]; Array[a, 90] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 05 2015 *)
prog: (PARI) a(n) = sumdiv(n, d, n/d*moebius(d)*numdiv(d)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 27 2014(PARI) a(n) = n*prod(p=1, n, if (isprime(p) && !(n % p), (1-2/p), 1)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 02 2016(Haskell)a058026 n = product $ zipWith (\p e -> p ^ (e - 1) * (p - 2))                              (a027748_row n) (a124010_row n)-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 10 2014
author: _Leroy Quet_, Nov 15 2000
